00042   int i;
00043   struct timespec now;

00045   //
00046   // Time we were called.  Delay is based on call time, not queued time
00047   //
00048   clock_gettime( CLOCK_REALTIME, &now);
00049   
00050 
00051   pthread_mutex_lock( &lstimer_mutex);
00052 
00053   for( i=0; i<LSTIMER_LIST_LENGTH; i++) {
00054     if( lstimer_list[i].shots == 0)
00055       break;
00056   }
00057 
00058   if( i == LSTIMER_LIST_LENGTH) {
00059     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lstimer_mutex);
00060     
00061     lslogging_log_message( "lstimer_add_timer: out of timers for event: %s, shots: %d,  secs: %u, nsecs: %u",
00062                           event, shots, secs, nsecs);
00063     return;
00064   }
00065 
00066   strncpy( lstimer_list[i].event, event, LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH - 1);
00067   lstimer_list[i].event[LSEVENTS_EVENT_LENGTH - 1] = 0;
00068   lstimer_list[i].shots        = shots;
00069   lstimer_list[i].delay_secs   = secs;
00070   lstimer_list[i].delay_nsecs  = nsecs;
00071 
00072   lstimer_list[i].next_secs    = secs + now.tv_sec + (now.tv_nsec + nsecs) / 1000000000;
00073   lstimer_list[i].next_nsecs   = (now.tv_nsec + nsecs) % 1000000000;
00074   lstimer_list[i].last_secs    = 0;
00075   lstimer_list[i].last_nsecs   = 0;
00076   
00077   lstimer_list[i].ncalls       = 0;
00078   lstimer_list[i].init_secs    = now.tv_sec;
00079   lstimer_list[i].init_nsecs   = now.tv_nsec;
00080 
00081   if( shots != 0) {
00082     lstimer_active_timers++;
00083     new_timer++;
00084   }
00085 
00086   pthread_cond_signal(  &lstimer_cond);
00087   pthread_mutex_unlock( &lstimer_mutex);
00088 }

00170                        {
00171   int
00172     i,
00173     known_timers;
00174 
00175   struct timespec now;
00176 
00177   struct sigevent  sev;
00178   struct sigaction sa;
00179   sigset_t mask;
00180 
00181   // See example at http://www.kernel.org/doc/man-pages/online/pages/man2/timer_create.2.html
00182   //
00183 
00184   // Set up hander
00185   //
00186   sa.sa_flags = SA_SIGINFO;
00187   sa.sa_sigaction = handler;
00188   sigemptyset(&sa.sa_mask);
00189   if (sigaction(SIGRTMIN, &sa, NULL) == -1) {
00190     lslogging_log_message( "lstimer_worker: sigaction failed");
00191     exit( -1);
00192   }
00193 
00194   // Create the timer
00195   //
00196   sev.sigev_notify = SIGEV_SIGNAL;
00197   sev.sigev_signo  = SIGRTMIN;
00198   sev.sigev_value.sival_ptr = &lstimer_timerid;
00199   timer_create( CLOCK_REALTIME, &sev, &lstimer_timerid);
00200 
00201 
00202   // Block timer signal for now since we really 
00203   // want to be sure we do not own a lock on the timer mutex
00204   // while servicing the signal
00205   //
00206   sigemptyset( &mask);
00207   sigaddset( &mask, SIGRTMIN);
00208   
00209   known_timers = 0;
00210 
00211   while( 1) {
00212     pthread_mutex_lock( &lstimer_mutex);
00213 
00214     while( new_timer == 0)
00215       pthread_cond_wait( &lstimer_cond, &lstimer_mutex);
00216 
00217     // ignore signals so we don't service the signal while we are already in the
00218     // service routine
00219     //
00220     sigprocmask( SIG_SETMASK, &mask, NULL);
00221     
00222 
00223     //
00224     // Setting up the timer interval is in the handler
00225     // so just call it
00226     //
00227     service_timers();
00228 
00229     //
00230     // Reset our flag
00231     //
00232     new_timer = 0;
00233 
00234     pthread_mutex_unlock( &lstimer_mutex);
00235 
00236 
00237     // Let the signals rain down
00238     //
00239     sigprocmask( SIG_UNBLOCK, &mask, NULL);
00240   }
00241 }

static void service_timers (  )  [static]

Definition at line 91 of file lstimer.c.

00091                              {
00092   int
00093     i,
00094     found_active;
00095 
00096   lstimer_list_t *p;
00097   struct timespec now, then, soonest;
00098   struct itimerspec its;
00099 
00100   //
00101   // Did I remind you not to let this thread own the lstimer mutex outside of this
00102   // service routine when SIGRTMIN is active?
00103   //
00104 
00105   // Call with lstimer_mutex locked
00106 
00107   clock_gettime( CLOCK_REALTIME, &now);
00108   //
00109   // Project a tad into the future
00110   then.tv_sec  = now.tv_sec + (now.tv_nsec + LSTIMER_RESOLUTION_NSECS) / 1000000000;
00111   then.tv_nsec = (now.tv_nsec + LSTIMER_RESOLUTION_NSECS) % 1000000000;
00112 
00113   found_active = 0;
00114   for( i=0; i<lstimer_active_timers; i++) {
00115     p = &(lstimer_list[i]);
00116     if( p->shots != 0) {
00117       found_active++;
00118       if(  p->next_secs < then.tv_sec || (p->next_secs == then.tv_sec && p->next_nsecs <= then.tv_nsec)) {
00119         lsevents_send_event( p->event);
00120         //
00121         // After sending the event, compute the next time we need to do this
00122         //
00123         p->last_secs  = now.tv_sec;
00124         p->last_nsecs = now.tv_nsec;
00125         p->ncalls++;
00126         //
00127         // Decrement non-infinite loops
00128         if( p->shots != -1)
00129           p->shots--;
00130         if( p->shots == 0) {
00131           //
00132           // Take this timer out of the mix
00133           lstimer_active_timers--;
00134         } else {
00135           p->next_secs  = p->init_secs + (p->ncalls+1) * p->delay_secs + (p->init_nsecs + (p->ncalls+1)*p->delay_nsecs)/1000000000;
00136           p->next_nsecs = (p->init_nsecs + (p->ncalls+1)*p->delay_nsecs) % 1000000000;
00137         }
00138       }
00139 
00140       if( found_active == 1) {
00141         soonest.tv_sec  = p->next_secs;
00142         soonest.tv_nsec = p->next_nsecs;
00143       } else {
00144         if( soonest.tv_sec > p->next_secs || (soonest.tv_sec == p->next_secs && soonest.tv_nsec > p->next_nsecs)) {
00145           soonest.tv_sec  = p->next_secs;
00146           soonest.tv_nsec = p->next_nsecs;
00147         }
00148       }
00149     }
00150   }
00151 
00152   if( soonest.tv_sec != 0) {
00153     its.it_value.tv_sec     = soonest.tv_sec;
00154     its.it_value.tv_nsec    = soonest.tv_nsec;
00155     its.it_interval.tv_sec  = 0;
00156     its.it_interval.tv_nsec = 0;
00157     timer_settime( lstimer_timerid, TIMER_ABSTIME, &its, NULL);
00158   }
00159 }
